This will generate the first part of the final shape. - **Part 2: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** 1. **Create a new coordinate system.** Use the Euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector [0.0, 0.2727, 0.0]. 2. **Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system.** 3. **Create a rectangle by drawing six lines.** Use the same sequence and endpoints as in Part 1. 4. **Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75.** 5. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D.** Use the given euler angles and translation vector to perform a 3D rotation and translation. 6. **Extrude the 2D sketch along the positive Z-axis.** Extrude the sketch by a depth of 0.2727 towards the normal and 0.0 in the opposite direction of the normal. Perform the "JoinFeatureOperation" as the boolean operation. This will merge the current part with the preceding part. These instructions will help the junior CAD designer create an accurate 3D model of the given final shape. The designer should follow the steps sequentially for each part and ensure that the 2D sketches and 3D transformations are accurately drawn and applied according to the given information.</description>
